VirtualFile.Name: Config.WTF
VirtualFile.Description: Config.WTF stores your last Battle.net and World of Warcraft account names, last realm and characters played, as well as video, sound and other settings. This Virtual File allows different Config.WTF files per Character.

WindowLayout.Name: Stacked27
WindowLayout.Description: This Window Layout features stacked windows with no border, the size of the full screen, on \\.\DISPLAY3. Swapping disabled. Does not leave space for the Windows taskbar. This style is great in conjunction with Video FX to see parts of, or all of, the other windows.

WindowLayout.Name: Solo
WindowLayout.Description: This Window Layout features a single window with no border, the size of the full screen.

WindowLayout.Name: Alge
WindowLayout.Description: This Window Layout features a single window with no border, the size of the full screen.

WindowLayout.Name: Hjalmar
WindowLayout.Description: This Window Layout features a single window with no border, the size of the full screen, on each of 1 screens. Swapping enabled.

WindowLayout.Name: TheHarem
WindowLayout.Description: This Window Layout features stacked windows with no border, the size of the full screen, on \\.\DISPLAY1. Swapping disabled. Leaves space for the Windows taskbar. This style is great in conjunction with Video FX to see parts of, or all of, the other windows.

RepeaterProfile.Name: Default
RepeaterProfile.Description:
It is not recommended to change the Startup defaults of the generated Repeater Profile, or to set Hotkeys in it. For best results, assign a hotkey through the Control Key Map instead.
When using the Quick Setup, you should rarely need to use Repeater. See the WoW Quick Start Guide at http://isboxer.com/index.php/guides/69-wow-guide-quick-start for information on Repeater and easily setting up all of the broadcasting keys that you need.

RelayGroup.Name: HumanoidCC
RelayGroup.Description: Characters that can crowd control Humanoids.

KeyMap.Name: General
KeyMap.Description: This Key Map is intended for general and non-combat use, things that can usually be used by all of your Character Sets.

MappedKey.Name: Dance With My Target
MappedKey.Description: This is an example of a key that assists and performs a WoW Macro, such as /dance. Similar macros can be used for achievements, e.g. /love (critters) and /hug (pvp).

MappedKey.Name: FTL Assist Me
MappedKey.Description:
This is the generated "Assist Me" key. It is automatically used by default by keys in the FTL DPS Keys map. You can also use this as a manual assist Hotkey, just change the Hotkey above as needed.
The way this key works is by sending a different set of modifiers (Alt, Ctrl, or Shift) along with a keystroke, so that the game basically performs a different /assist macro depending on which window it is sent from. That is "FTL" in a nutshell.
If you want a subset (e.g. an Action Target Group) of characters to assist you instead of all of the others, make a copy of this Mapped Key and adjust the Target of the action in step 1.

MappedKey.Name: FTL Follow Me
MappedKey.Description:
This is the generated "Follow Me" key. It is automatically used by default by keys in the Control map. You can also use this as a manual follow Hotkey, just change the Hotkey above as needed.
The way this key works is by sending a different set of modifiers (Alt, Ctrl, or Shift) along with a keystroke, so that the game basically performs a different /follow macro depending on which window it is sent from. That is "FTL" in a nutshell.
If you want a subset (e.g. an Action Target Group) of characters to follow you instead of all of the others, make a copy of this Mapped Key and adjust the Target of the action in step 1.

MappedKey.Name: FTL Target Me
MappedKey.Description:
This is the generated "Target Me" key. It does not have a Hotkey by default, nor is it used by other maps by default.
The way this key works is by sending a different set of modifiers (Alt, Ctrl, or Shift) along with a keystroke, so that the game basically performs a different /target macro depending on which window it is sent from. That is "FTL" in a nutshell.
If you want a subset (e.g. an Action Target Group) of characters to target you instead of all of the others, make a copy of this Mapped Key and adjust the Target of the action in step 1.

MappedKey.Name: Interact with Target
MappedKey.Description:
The WoW Quick Start Guide has a section that explains how to set up Interact with Target, which will help you interact with NPCs (e.g. merchants, quest givers and enemies) and, when combined with Click to Move, can be used to keep melees on target.
See http://isboxer.com/wiki/WoW:Quick_Start_Guide#Interaction_with_NPCs.

MappedKey.Name: Interact with Target - Keep CTM
MappedKey.Description:
Same as the other Interact with Target, except this one does not automatically disable Click to Move afterward.
The WoW Quick Start Guide has a section that explains how to set up Interact with Target, which will help you interact with NPCs (e.g. merchants, quest givers and enemies) and, when combined with Click to Move, can be used to keep melees on target.
See http://isboxer.com/wiki/WoW:Quick_Start_Guide#Interaction_with_NPCs.

MappedKey.Name: Invite Others
MappedKey.Description: Invites other Characters in your Character Set to group. If you have linked Character Sets together with Also Launch, you may want to adjust the macro to /invite additional characters.

MappedKey.Name: Others Jump
MappedKey.Description: Makes your other characters jump.

MappedKey.Name: Toggle Jamba Follow Strobing
MappedKey.Description: Turns Jamba Follow Strobing on or off

MappedKey.Name: Flying V Formation
MappedKey.Description:
Make sure your movement keys are configured under Variable Keystrokes in order to use this Formation!
The Flying V aligns your characters in a V behind the leader. This example mapping always aligns them behind the character in slot 1. Works for up to 5 total characters.

MappedKey.Name: Line Formation
MappedKey.Description:
Make sure your movement keys are configured under Variable Keystrokes in order to use this Formation!
The Line formation aligns your characters in a line to the left and right of the leader. This example mapping always aligns them next to the character in slot 1. Works for up to 5 characters.

MappedKey.Name: Star Formation
MappedKey.Description:
Make sure your movement keys are configured under Variable Keystrokes in order to use this Formation!
The Star formation aligns your characters in all four directions around the leader (forward, backward, left and right). This example mapping always aligns them around the character in slot 1. Works for up to 5 characters.

MappedKey.Name: Others turn Left
MappedKey.Description:
Make sure your movement keys are configured under Variable Keystrokes in order to use this!
This can be used to break auto-follow (some games do not provide a more convenient method), just set a Hotkey and, if needed, change the key it sends to the other windows in step 1.

MappedKey.Name: Others turn Right
MappedKey.Description:
Make sure your movement keys are configured under Variable Keystrokes in order to use this!
This can be used to break auto-follow (some games do not provide a more convenient method), just set a Hotkey and, if needed, change the key it sends to the other windows in step 1.

KeyMap.Name: Control
KeyMap.Description: This Key Map is intended to always be on, which means that all of the hotkeys are in use even if you turn off Key Maps in-game. It contains the toggles for the other Key Maps and Repeater, as well as various mappings used by other features.

MappedKey.Name: Activate Maps
MappedKey.Description:
This toggles Key Maps. It is used by, and updates, the "A,A" icon that shows up by default in the upper left corner in game (a button in the Click Bar called Broadcast).
If you create your own Key Maps (as opposed to adding Mapped Keys to the current Key Maps), you will need to add a Key Map State Action to steps 1 and 2 of this key if you want to toggle your new Key Map. Additionally, if you have different Key Maps per Character Set, you may want to black list any conflicting Key Maps through your Character Set. (Select your Character Set in the top pane, then "Key Maps" in the bottom left pane.)

MappedKey.Name: Activate Mouse Repeat
MappedKey.Description: This toggles Mouse Repeat (1 to 1 broadcasting for the mouse) from the current window to all others. It does not have a Hotkey by default.

MappedKey.Name: Activate Repeat
MappedKey.Description: This toggles both Key and Mouse Repeat (1 to 1 broadcasting for both keyboard and mouse) from the current window to all others.

MappedKey.Name: Click to Move Off
MappedKey.Description: This turns Click to Move off. It is used by the Interact with Target key in the General Key Map.

MappedKey.Name: Click to Move On
MappedKey.Description: This turns Click to Move on. It is used by the Interact with Target key in the General Key Map.

MappedKey.Name: Follow
MappedKey.Description:
This uses the FTL Follow Me key under the General Key Map. It does not have a Hotkey by default.
The Quick Setup Wizard uses this and similar mappings for whatever character switching (e.g. follow upon character switch) options were selected on the last page. A different Mapped Key can be selected later if desired, by selecting it per Slot in your Character Set (in a drop-down box on the right side). Or just run the wizard again...

MappedKey.Name: Follow/JambaMaster
MappedKey.Description:
This uses the FTL Follow Me key under the General Key Map, and the JambaMaster key under this Key Map. It does not have a Hotkey by default.
The Quick Setup Wizard uses this and similar mappings for whatever character switching (e.g. follow upon character switch) options were selected on the last page. A different Mapped Key can be selected later if desired, by selecting it per Slot in your Character Set (in a drop-down box on the right side). Or just run the wizard again...

MappedKey.Name: Follow/JambaStrobe
MappedKey.Description:
This uses the FTL Follow Me key under the General Key Map, and the JambaStrobe On key under this Key Map. It does not have a Hotkey by default.
The Quick Setup Wizard uses this and similar mappings for whatever character switching (e.g. follow upon character switch) options were selected on the last page. A different Mapped Key can be selected later if desired, by selecting it per Slot in your Character Set (in a drop-down box on the right side). Or just run the wizard again...

MappedKey.Name: Follow/JambaStrobe/JambaMaster
MappedKey.Description:
This uses the FTL Follow Me key under the General Key Map, the JambaMaster and the JambaStrobe On key under this Key Map. It does not have a Hotkey by default.
The Quick Setup Wizard uses this and similar mappings for whatever character switching (e.g. follow upon character switch) options were selected on the last page. A different Mapped Key can be selected later if desired, by selecting it per Slot in your Character Set (in a drop-down box on the right side). Or just run the wizard again...

MappedKey.Name: JambaMaster
MappedKey.Description:
This tells the Jamba Addon to tell the other characters the current one is master.
The Quick Setup Wizard uses this and similar mappings for whatever character switching (e.g. follow upon character switch) options were selected on the last page. A different Mapped Key can be selected later if desired, by selecting it per Slot in your Character Set (in a drop-down box on the right side). Or just run the wizard again...

MappedKey.Name: JambaStrobe Off
MappedKey.Description: This tells the Jamba Addon to turn off follow strobing. It is used by Toggle Jamba Follow Strobing in the General Key Map.

MappedKey.Name: JambaStrobe On
MappedKey.Description: This tells the Jamba Addon to turn on follow strobing. It is used by Toggle Jamba Follow Strobing in the General Key Map.

MappedKey.Name: Special
MappedKey.Description: Generated by Mapped Key Wizard with 'Alternate Hotkey'. The 'Hold' option is used here to retain the original Hotkey's behavior for when it is Pressed and Released.

MappedKey.Name: Special
MappedKey.Description: Generated by Mapped Key Wizard with 'Alternate Hotkey'. The 'Hold' option is used here to retain the original Hotkey's behavior for when it is Pressed and Released.

WoWMacro.WoWMacroString: Legacy of the Emperor (General Monk Buff)
Legacy of the Emperor (General Monk Buff)
Legacy of the Emperor (General Monk Buff)
Legacy of the Emperor (General Monk Buff)

WoWMacro.MacroCommands:
/stopmacro [target=target,noexists] [noharm] [dead] /startattack
/script UIErrorsFrame:Hide(); /console Sound_EnableSFX 0
/castsequence reset=target Flame Shock,Lava Burst,Earth Shock,Lava Burst /cast Stormstrike /cast Lava Lash
/script UIErrorsFrame:Clear(); /console Sound_EnableSFX 1

/stopmacro [target=target,noexists] [noharm] [dead] /startattack
/script UIErrorsFrame:Hide(); /console Sound_EnableSFX 0
/castsequence reset=combat Call of the Elements, NULL /cast Lava Lash /cast Stormstrike
/script UIErrorsFrame:Clear(); /console Sound_EnableSFX 1

/stopmacro [target=target,noexists] [noharm] [dead] [channeling] /startattack
/script UIErrorsFrame:Hide(); /console Sound_EnableSFX 0
/castsequence reset=target Flame Shock,Lightning Bolt,Lightning Bolt,Lightning Bolt,Lightning Bolt,Earth Shock, Lightning Bolt, Lightning Bolt,Lightning Bolt, Lightning Bolt
/script UIErrorsFrame:Clear(); /console Sound_EnableSFX 1

/stopmacro [target=target,noexists] [noharm] [dead] [channeling] /startattack
/script UIErrorsFrame:Hide(); /console Sound_EnableSFX 0
/castsequence reset=combat/8 Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Searing Totem,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Lava Burst,Searing Totem
/script UIErrorsFrame:Clear(); /console Sound_EnableSFX 1

/script UIErrorsFrame:Hide(); /console Sound_EnableSFX 0
/castsequence reset=combat Magma Totem,Fire Nova,Chain Lightning,Chain Lightning,Chain Lightning,Fire Nova,Chain Lightning,Chain Lightning,Chain Lightning /use 13 /cast Elemental Mastery
/script UIErrorsFrame:Clear(); /console Sound_EnableSFX 1

/stopmacro [target=target,noexists] [noharm] [dead] [channeling] /startattack
/script UIErrorsFrame:Hide(); /console Sound_EnableSFX 0
/cast Unleash Elements /use 14 /use 13
/script UIErrorsFrame:Clear(); /console Sound_EnableSFX 1

/stopmacro [target=target,noexists] [noharm] [dead] [channeling]
/script UIErrorsFrame:Hide(); /console Sound_EnableSFX 0
!if (character is "Hypallage") /castsequence reset=target Frostbolt,Fireball,Fireball,Fireball,Fireball !if (character is "Bligr") /castsequence reset=target Fireball,Fireball !also /cast Arcane Missiles

/stopmacro [target=target,noexists] [noharm] [dead] [channeling]

/cast Presence of Mind /castsequence reset=6 Arcane Blast,Arcane Blast,Arcane Blast,Arcane Blast,Arcane Barrage /use 13 /use 14
/script UIErrorsFrame:Clear(); /console Sound_EnableSFX 1

/stopmacro [noharm] [dead]
/script UIErrorsFrame:Hide(); /console Sound_EnableSFX 0

/stopmacro [target=target,noexists] [noharm] [dead] [channeling]

/stopmacro [target=target,noexists] [noharm] [dead] [channeling]

/stopmacro [target=target,noexists] [noharm] [dead] [channeling]

WoWMacroSet.Name: General
WoWMacroSet.Description: This WoW Macro Set was generated from WoW Macro Actions in the Key Map 'General'

WoWMacro.MacroCommands: /run if setV == 4 then SetView(1); setV = 1; else setV = 4; SetView(4) end
/cast [target=mouseover, exists, harm] Dark Command; Dark Command

/castsequence reset=combat icy touch, plague strike, pestilence, blood boil, death strike, icy touch, plague strike, blood boil, heart strike, plague strike, blood boil, icy touch, heart strike
/cast rune strike

/stopmacro [target=target,noexists] [noharm] [dead] /startattack
/script UIErrorsFrame:Hide(); /console Sound_EnableSFX 0
/castsequence reset=combat icy touch, plague strike, pestilence, icy touch, plague strike, blood strike
/script UIErrorsFrame:Clear(); /console Sound_EnableSFX 1

WoWMacroSet.Name: Quick Setup 38
WoWMacroSet.Description: This WoW Macro Set contains all of the macros generated by the Quick Setup Wizard from ISBoxer 38

WoWMacro.Name: SlashDance
WoWMacro.Description: Just dance.

WoWMacro.Name: FTLAssist
WoWMacro.Description: Assists a specific character, depending on the optional modifiers included.

WoWMacro.Name: FTLFollow
WoWMacro.Description: Auto-follows a specific character, depending on the optional modifiers included.

WoWMacro.Name: FTLTarget
WoWMacro.Description: Targets a specific character, depending on the optional modifiers included.

WoWMacro.Name: InviteTeam
WoWMacro.Description: Invites up to 5 Slots in the current Character Set to party

WoWMacro.Name: CTMOn
WoWMacro.Description: Enables Click-to-Move. This is commonly used with Interact with Target to cause a Character to move toward its target.

WoWMacro.Name: CTMOff
WoWMacro.Description: Disables Click-to-Move

WoWMacro.Name: JambaMaster
WoWMacro.Description: This will have the Jamba WoW Addon send a message via in-game Addon communications to the other Characters, instructing them to set this Character as its Master.

WoWMacro.Name: JambaStrobeOn
WoWMacro.Description: This will have the Jamba WoW Addon send a message via in-game Addon communications to the other Characters, instructing them to enable its Auto-follow Strobing feature on this Character.

WoWMacro.Name: JambaStrobeOff
WoWMacro.Description: This will have the Jamba WoW Addon send a message via in-game Addon communications to the other Characters, instructing them to disable Auto-follow Strobing.
Reloads the WoW interface. This will activate any ISBoxer WoW Macro changes made (after an Export while playing).

WoWMacro.Name: FollowTrain
WoWMacro.Description: Each Character follows the Character in the higher Slot.

WoWMacro.MacroCommands: /click ErrorsOFF /cast Invoke Xuen, the White Tiger /click ErrorsON
/click ErrorsOFF /cast Legacy of the Emperor /click ErrorsON
WoWMacro.ColloquialName: Legacy of the Emperor (General Monk Buff)
WoWMacro.Description:
You extol the words of the last emperor, increasing Strength, Agility, and Intellect by 5%.
If target is in your party or raid, all party and raid members will be affected.

WoWMacro.MacroCommands: /click ErrorsOFF /cast Legacy of the White Tiger /click ErrorsON
WoWMacro.ColloquialName: Legacy of the White Tiger (Windwalker Buff)
WoWMacro.Description:
Instant cast
You honor the White Tiger's legacy, increasing critical strike chance by 5%. If target is in your party or raid, all party and raid members will be affected.

WoWMacro.MacroCommands: /click ErrorsOFF /cast Stance of the Fierce Tiger /click ErrorsON
/click ErrorsOFF /cast Stance of the Sturdy Ox /click ErrorsON
WoWMacro.ColloquialName: Stance of the Sturdy Ox (Brewmaster Stance)

WoWMacro.MacroCommands: /click ErrorsOFF /cast Stance of the Wise Serpent /click ErrorsON
WoWMacro.ColloquialName: Stance of the Wise Serpent (Mistweaver Stance)

WoWMacro.MacroCommands: /click ErrorsOFF /cast Summon Black Ox Statue /click ErrorsON

WoWMacro.Description:
45 sec cooldown
Surrounds the Death Knight in an Anti-Magic Shell, absorbing 75% of damage dealt by harmful spells (up to a maximum of 50% of the Death Knight's health) and preventing application of harmful magical effects. Damage absorbed generates Runic Power. Lasts 5 sec.

WoWMacro.MacroCommands: /click ErrorsOFF /cast Army of the Dead /click ErrorsON
WoWMacro.Description: Army of the Dead 1 Blood, 1 Unholy, 1 Frost Channeled 10 min cooldown
Boils the blood of all enemies within 10 yards, dealing X Shadow damage. Deals additional damage to targets infected with Blood Plague or Frost Fever.

You assume the presence of Blood, increasing Stamina by 8% and base armor by 55%, and reducing damage taken by 10%. Threat generation is also significantly increased.
Only one Presence may be active at a time, and assuming a new Presence will consume any stored Runic Power.
Instantly strike the enemy, causing 40% weapon damage plus X. Damage is increased by 12.5% for each of your diseases on the target.
Shackles the target with frozen chains, reducing movement speed by 60% for 8 sec. Also infects the target with Frost Fever.

Dominates the target undead creature, forcing it to do your bidding. While controlled, the time between the undead minion's attacks is increased by 30% and its casting speed is slowed by 20%. Lasts up to 5 min.

Ground AoE'
30 sec cooldown
Corrupts the ground targeted by the Death Knight, causing Shadow damage every sec to targets that remain in the area for 10 sec.
Fire a blast of unholy energy, causing (X + 51.4% * AP) Shadow damage to an enemy target or healing (X + 180% * AP) damage on a friendly Undead target.

25 Sec cooldown
Harness the unholy energy that surrounds and binds all matter, drawing the target toward the Death Knight and forcing the enemy to attack the Death Knight for 3 sec.

A deadly attack that deals 150% weapon damage plus (((X * 150 / 100))), healing you for 20% of the damage you have sustained during the preceding 5 sec (minimum of at least 7% of your maximum health).

WoWMacro.Name: DkFrostPres
WoWMacro.Description: Strengthens you with the presence of Frost, increasing damage by 10% and increasing Runic Power generation by 10%. Only one Presence may be active at a time, and assuming a new Presence will consume any stored Runic Power.

WoWMacro.MacroCommands: /click ErrorsOFF /castsequence reset=60 Horn of Winter /click ErrorsON
WoWMacro.Name: DkHoW
WoWMacro.Description:
20 sec cooldown
The Death Knight blows the Horn of Winter, which generates 10 Runic Power and increases attack power of all party and raid members within 100 yards by 10%. Lasts 5 min.

WoWMacro.Name: DkIFort
WoWMacro.Description:
3 min cooldown
The Death Knight freezes <his/her> blood to become immune to Stun effects and reduce all damage taken by 20% for 12 sec.

WoWMacro.Name: DkIT
WoWMacro.Description:
6 sec cooldown
Chills the target for (X + 31.9% * AP) Frost damage and infects them with Frost Fever, a disease that deals periodic frost damage for 30 sec.

WoWMacro.Name: DkMFreeze
WoWMacro.Description:
15 sec cooldown
Smash the target's mind with cold, interrupting spellcasting and preventing any spell in that school from being cast for 4 sec.

Your freezing aura creates ice beneath your feet, allowing party or raid members within 50 yards to walk on water for 10 min. Works while mounted, but being attacked or receiving damage will cancel the effect.
Spreads existing Blood Plague and Frost Fever infections from your target to all other enemies within 10 yards.

WoWMacro.Name: DkPStrike
WoWMacro.Description: A vicious strike that deals 100% weapon damage plus X and infects the target with Blood Plague, a disease dealing Shadow damage over time.

WoWMacro.Name: DkRDead
WoWMacro.Description:
2 min cooldown
Raises a ghoul to fight by your side. You can have a maximum of one ghoul at a time. Lasts 1 min.

WoWMacro.Name: DkStrang
WoWMacro.Description:
2 min cooldown
Shadowy tendrils constrict an enemy's throat, silencing them for 5 sec. Non-player victim spellcasting is also interrupted for 3 sec.

WoWMacro.Name: DkUPres
WoWMacro.Description:
You are infused with unholy fury, increasing attack speed and rune regeneration by 10%, and movement speed by 15%.
Only one Presence may be active at a time, and assuming a new Presence will consume any stored Runic Power.

WoWMacro.MacroCommands:
/click ErrorsOFF
/castsequence [mod]Blood Boil;reset=target/5 Icy Touch,Plague Strike,null /castrandom Rune Strike,Death Strike,Dancing Rune Weapon /cast !Bone Shield /cast !Horn of Winter /cast !Life Blood
/click ErrorsON

/click ErrorsOFF
/castsequence reset=target/6 Howling Blast,Plague Strike,Obliterate /castsequence reset=20 Horn of Winter,Plague Leech /cast Pillar of Frost /cast Empower Rune Weapon /cast Raise Dead
/click ErrorsON

/click ErrorsOFF
/castsequence [mod]Death Coil;reset=6/target Soul Reaper,Festering Strike,Scourge Strike,Festering Strike /cast !Dark Transformation /cast Unholy Frenzy /cast Summon Gargoyle /cast !Empower Rune Weapon
/click ErrorsON

WoWMacro.Name: CatForm
WoWMacro.Description:
Instant cast
Shapeshift into Cat Form, causing Agility to increase attack power, increasing autoattack damage by 100%, and increasing movement speed by 25%.
Also protects the caster from Polymorph effects and allows the use of various cat abilities.
Energy regeneration continues while not in Cat Form.
The act of shapeshifting frees the caster of movement impairing effects.

Instant cast
Requires Bear From/Cat Form
Mangle the target, inflicting damage and causing the target to take additional damage from bleed effects for 1 min. This ability can be used in Cat Form or Bear Form.

WoWMacro.MacroCommands: /click ErrorsOFF /cast Mark of the Wild /click ErrorsON

WoWMacro.Description:
Instant cast
Can be cast in Tree of Life Form, Moonkin Form
Balance: Burns the enemy for X Arcane damage and then an additional Y Arcane damage over 14 sec. Your Starfire and Starsurge critical strikes on the target will extend your Moonfire's duration by 2 sec.
Feral, Guardian, Restoration: Burns the enemy for X Arcane damage and then an additional Y Arcane damage over 14 sec.

Instant Cast 10 Sec Cooldown
Requires Cat Form
Allows the Druid to prowl around, but reduces your movement speed by 30%. Lasts until cancelled.

nstant cast
Heals the target for X and an addtional Y every 3 sec for 12 sec.
2 sec cast Causes X Nature damage to the target.

WoWMacro.MacroCommands: /click ErrorsOFF /cast Heart of the Wild /click ErrorsON
/click ErrorsOFF /cast Mark of the Wild /click ErrorsON
WoWMacro.Description: Increases the friendly target's Strength, Agility, and Intellect by 5% for 1 hour. If target is in your party or raid, all party and raid members will be affected.

WoWMacro.MacroCommands:
/click ErrorsOFF
/castsequence [mod]Wrath;reset=target/4 Moonfire,Sunfire,Starfire,Starfire,Starfire,Starfire /cast Starsurge /cast Celestial Alignment /cast Incarnation: Chosen of Elune
/click ErrorsON
WoWMacro.Description:
If you need to refresh DoT’s in Eclipse (Solar)
Just release the modifier (Alt, Ctrl or Shift) and hit the macro to refresh the DoT’s and go back spamming with the modifier again!

WoWMacro.MacroCommands:
/click ErrorsOFF
/castsequence [stealth]Pounce /castsequence reset=target Mangle,Rip,Rake,Mangle,Savage Roar,Mangle,Rake,Mangle /cast [nocombat]Prowl /cast Faerie Fire /cast [combat]Tiger’s Fury /cast [combat]Berserk /cast [combat]Barkskin /cast [combat]Cenarion Ward
/click ErrorsON

/click ErrorsOFF
/castsequence reset=target Growl,Thrash,Lacerate,Mangle,Swipe,Lacerate,Swipe /cast !Savage Defense /cast !Enrage /cast !Survival Instincts /cast !Incarnation: Son of Ursoc /cast !Wild Charge /cast !Frenzied Regeneration
/click ErrorsON
/click ErrorsOFF /cast A Murder of Crows /click ErrorsON
/click ErrorsOFF /cast Aspect of the Cheetah /click ErrorsON
/click ErrorsOFF /cast Aspect of the Fox /click ErrorsON
/click ErrorsOFF /cast Aspect of the Iron Hawk /click ErrorsON
/click ErrorsOFF /cast Aspect of the Pack /click ErrorsON

/click ErrorsOFF
/startattack /castsequence reset=target/3 Serpent Sting,null /castsequence !Cobra Shot /castsequence Kill Command,Arcane Shot,Arcane Shot /castsequence Focus Fire,Dire Beast /cast A Murder of Crows /cast Bestial Wrath /cast Rapid Fire /cast Kill Shot
/click ErrorsON
WoWMacro.Description:
/cast A Murder of Crows
Note: This can be taken out if you didn't spec with this in your Talents

WoWMacro.MacroCommands:
/click ErrorsOFF
/castsequence reset=target Serpent Sting,Arcane Shot,Arcane Shot,Steady Shot, Steady Shot,Arcane Shot,Arcane Shot,Steady Shot /cast !Kill Shot /cast !Blink Strike /cast !Rapid Fire /cast !Readiness
/click ErrorsON
WoWMacro.Description:
/cast !Blink Strike
This can be replaced by whatever talent you chose.

WoWMacro.MacroCommands:
/click ErrorsOFF
/castsequence [mod]Arcane Shot;reset=target Serpent Sting,null /cast Cobra Shot /cast Explosive Shot /castsequence reset=20 Black Arrow,Dire Beast, Arcane Shot, Arcane Shot, Arcane Shot /cast Rapid Fire /cast Kill Shot /cast Blood Fury
/startattack
/click ErrorsON
WoWMacro.Description:
/cast Blood Fury
You may wanna change this racial around to whatever your Class is.

WoWMacro.Name: MageBuff
WoWMacro.Description:
Instant cast
Infuses the target with brilliance, increasing their spell power by 10% and their critical strike chance by 5% for 1 hour.
If target is in your party or raid, all party and raid members will be affected.

WoWMacro.MacroCommands: /click ErrorsOFF /cast Guardian of Ancient Kings /click ErrorsON

WoWMacro.Description:
Instant cast
A burst of Holy energy fills the caster, increasing the armor value from items by 60% and spell power by 10%.

WoWMacro.Name: PriestFort
WoWMacro.Description:
Instant cast
Infuses the target with vitality, increasing Stamina by 10% for 1 hour.
If the target is in your party or raid, all party and raid members will be affected.

Instant cast
Assume a Shadowform, increasing your Shadow damage by 20%, reducing all damage done to you by 15%, and increasing all party and raid members spell haste by 5%. However, you may not cast Holy spells while in this form.

WoWMacro.MacroCommands: /click ErrorsOFF /cast Tricks of the Trade /click ErrorsON
/click ErrorsOFF /cast Call of the Elements /click ErrorsON
/click ErrorsOFF /cast Curse of the Elements /click ErrorsON

WoWMacro.Description:
Instant cast
Infuses all party and raid members with shadow, increasing their spell power by 10% for 1 hour.
If the target is in your party or raid, all party and raid members will be affected.

WoWMacro.ColloquialName: Rain of Fire (Ground AoE Affliction and Destruction)

WoWMacro.Description:
1 min cooldown
Increases the attack power of all raid and party members within 100 yards by 10%. Lasts 5 min.
Generates 20 Rage.

WoWMacro.MacroCommands: /click ErrorsOFF /cast Die by the Sword /click ErrorsON
WoWMacro.ColloquialName: Die by the Sword (Arms and Fury)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Move Forward
VariableKeystroke.Description: Moves the character forward. (Requires HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Move Backward
VariableKeystroke.Description: Moves the character backward. (Requires HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Turn Left
VariableKeystroke.Description: Turns the character counter-clockwise. (Requires HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Turn Right
VariableKeystroke.Description: Turns the character clockwise. (Requires HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Move Left
VariableKeystroke.Description: Strafes the character left. (Requires HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Move Right
VariableKeystroke.Description: Strafes the character right. (Requires HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Jump
VariableKeystroke.Description: Makes the character jump. (May require HOLD option on Mapped Key)

VariableKeystroke.Name: Follow Target
VariableKeystroke.Description: Most MMORPGs include an Auto-Follow feature, which is useful to move your characters together as a group.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Assist Target
VariableKeystroke.Description: Causes the character to select his target's target, such as to assist in combat against the same enemy. Most games include this feature.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Self
VariableKeystroke.Description: Causes the character to select himself.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Slot 1
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured individually for each Slot in your Character Set, in order to target the Character in Slot 1, in the game. This is useful for being able to easily Auto-Follow or Assist each window.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Slot 2
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured individually for each Slot in your Character Set, in order to target the Character in Slot 2, in the game. This is useful for being able to easily Auto-Follow or Assist each window.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Slot 3
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured individually for each Slot in your Character Set, in order to target the Character in Slot 3, in the game. This is useful for being able to easily Auto-Follow or Assist each window.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Slot 4
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured individually for each Slot in your Character Set, in order to target the Character in Slot 4, in the game. This is useful for being able to easily Auto-Follow or Assist each window.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Slot 5
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured individually for each Slot in your Character Set, in order to target the Character in Slot 5, in the game. This is useful for being able to easily Auto-Follow or Assist each window.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Target Slot 6
VariableKeystroke.Description: This can be configured individually for each Slot in your Character Set, in order to target the Character in Slot 6, in the game. This is useful for being able to easily Auto-Follow or Assist each window.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Interact with Target
VariableKeystroke.Description: While most MMORPGs require actually clicking with the mouse to perform the default 'right click' action, others including World of Warcraft provide a configurable Hotkey for the same capability.

VariableKeystroke.Name: Focus my Target
VariableKeystroke.Description: Focus is a secondary target available in some games, to remain 'focused' on a target while still being able to click or otherwise select others.
